title: BBC Local Live: Herefordshire & Worcestershire on Friday 25 August 2017 - BBC News
summary: 'we just wanted to come home '' - terror attack witness .
campaign for statue to honour vc hero .
butcher 's tutorial videos are online hit .

documents.title: watch : today 's weather for the west midlands
text: a wet start for some of us - here 's how the rest of wednesday is looking .
you can also find updated weather forecasts at any other time via the bbc weather website .
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: taylor ton helps glos rally at worcester
text: taylor ton helps glos rally at worcester

documents.title: man jailed after wholesale market fire
text: man jailed after wholesale market fire

documents.title: market place 's £ 1.5m transformation approved
text: planning permission has been given on a £ 1.5m project to transform angel place in worcester city centre .

the regeneration will see the refurbishment of the main entrance to crowngate shopping centre , in friary walk , which is already home to retailers including new look , mothercare and vision express .
the plans will complete the regeneration of angel place as a market place and public square , the council says .

documents.title: fresh image issued of wanted man
text: a fresh image of a man wanted on sus of a serious sexual offence and wounding with intent to cause grievous bodily harm has been issued by police .
west mercia police is warning the public not to approach ashley shearon , who 's 48 , but to contact them if they see him .

documents.title: a49 collision : tractor pulling hay and 4x4 involved
text: the fatal collision on the a49 last night involved a 4x4 and a tractor pulling a trailer with hay on it , the ambulance service says .
it happened at 21:45 on the a49 between bryn garth and much birch , near to the axe & cleaver pub .
west midlands ambulance service says the driver of the 4x4 died at the scene and a 34-year-old woman , who was a front seat passenger , was taken to hereford county hospital with facial injuries .
the 49-year-old tractor driver was `` clearly distressed but uninjured '' , a spokesman said .

documents.title: trial of 'roundabout camper ' postponed
text: the trial of a hereford woman who has been sleeping in public places for months , including the main roundabout in hereford and the bandstand in ross-on-wye , has been postponed until 11 september .
samantha lamputt is charged with breaking a criminal behaviour order .

documents.title: breakingman jailed for starting huge fire at market
text: a man has been sentenced to five years in prison for a fire at birmingham 's wholesale market in 2015 .

stephen wilkinson , 60 , of mickleton close , redditch , had earlier this month been found guilty of arson reckless as to whether life was in danger , having set fire to a pile of boxes , causing damage to the venue totaling more than £ 500,000 .
he had worked at the market from the age of 15 .
wilkinson is set to be released on licence upon serving two and a half years .
at its peak , 40 firefighters tackled the severe blaze at the site in pershore street , digbeth .
author: Kevin Reide
Reporter, Midlands Today

documents.title: new elgar statue plinth damaged twice in less than a week
text: damage to a new plinth serving an iconic worcester monument has been discovered twice in less than a week .
author: Worcester News

documents.title: military wives choir to sing at cathedral
text: the military wives choir will sing in worcester as part of a national tour of cathedrals .
the choir , made up of wives and partners of armed forces personnel and women from the wider military community , will perform at worcester cathedral on 22 november .

documents.title: slideshow : leaves , fruit and fields
text: there may not be the glorious sun about we enjoyed on the bank holiday , but bbc weather watchers have still been busy with their cameras .
thanks to j at severn ridge , johnqa , happysnapper71 and wendywoo for these photos
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: tributes paid to hugely popular kidderminster football boss
text: tributes have poured in for a much-loved kidderminster football manager and prize winning horticulturist who has died at the age of 81 .
author: Kidderminster Shuttle

documents.title: quo to headline sunshine festival
text: status quo will be rocking all over upton-upon-severn at next year 's sunshine festival , the organisers have announced .
a crowd of 6,000 people attended the three-day music event this year , which came to an end over the bank holiday weekend .

documents.title: hos given the go-ahead for £ 5m extension
text: a hos has been given planning permission for a £ 5.3m extension and redevelopment .
st richard 's hos will go ahead with the redevelopment of its site at wildwood drive , in worcester , to help it meet `` the ever-increasing need for hos care '' .
the redevelopment will involve a new reception area , larger rooms suitable for exercise based groups , an occupational therapy kitchen , more counselling rooms and a bigger social and eating area .

we are already at full capacity and the demand is set to rise sharply with our aging population and people living longer with multiple illnesses such as heart failure , parkinson 's , and motor neurone disease as well as cancer

documents.title: stillborn babies remembered with graveyard garden
text: a plaque has been unveiled in memory of stillborn babies who were buried in unmarked graves .
author: Malvern Gazette

documents.title: ex-england cricketer graveney remembered
text: ex-england cricketer graveney remembered

documents.title: worcester name hughes as joint-manager
text: worcester name hughes as joint-manager

documents.title: family reunited with lost memorial bench
text: family reunited with lost memorial bench

documents.title: london midland loses rail franchise
text: london midland loses rail franchise

documents.title: travel : fish hill in worcestershire blocked
text: the a44 road between broadway and stow-on-the-wold is blocked , police say .
a collision has just occurred on fish hill , broadway .
road is currently blocked and closed .
please find an alternative route .
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: watch : civil war park launches interactive memory trail
text: i 've been to fort royal park , in worcester , to take a look at a new interactive trail which allows visitors to watch videos of people 's memories of the area on their smartphones .
the site played a vital part in the battle of worcester , which ended the english civil war .
author: Justyn Surrall
BBC Hereford and Worcester

documents.title: rowers abandon polar expedition due to lack of sun
text: a group of rowers , including a worcestershire olympian , have abandoned their polar sea expedition , but have still broken eight world records .
olympic gold medallist alex gregory , who went to school in evesham , was part of a team trying to row from norway to iceland .
the group sought refuge on a remote norwegian island after five days with no visible sun meant the boat 's solar-powered batteries had drained .
i 've never been so wet and cold .
it 's seeping into my bones , there is absolutely no escape from it

documents.title: slideshow : white lions and a blistering bank holiday
text: the gorgeous bank holiday weather meant bbc weather watchers were out and about with their cameras - here are some of their best photos .
thanks to karlsskies , jon david , happysnapper71 , and steve for this selection .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: cricket : worcestershire all out for 363
text: worcestershire added 25 runs to their overnight total for the loss of three wickets , ending their first innings against gloucestershire on 363 .
you can hear ball-by-ball commentary on the visitor 's reply on bbc hereford & worcester 's 738am frequency and online .
author: Dave Bradley
Cricket commentator

documents.title: pub pledges to retain community spirit after extensive revamp
text: one of the oldest buildings in the city has relaunched to drinkers after an extensive refurbishment .
author: Worcester News

documents.title: watch : firework display over cathedral ends festival
text: a firework display brought the worcester festival to a close on monday night .

documents.title: football : bulls fa cup tickets go on sale
text: tickets for hereford fc 's fa cup tie against godalming town will go on sale to non season ticket holders tomorrow .
the match at edgar street takes place on saturday .
season ticket holders will be able to buy seats from 12:00 on tuesday .

documents.title: a49 crash : more details released by police
text: a 46-year-old man has died after the car he was driving was in collision with a tractor on the a49 near the axe & cleaver pub in much birch , herefordshire , police say .
his 34-year-old female passenger was taken to hospital with serious but non life threatening facial injuries after the crash at 21:52 on monday .
the road is expected to remain closed until early afternoon and west mercia police says people are advised to find an alternative route .

documents.title: animal cruelty cry over bull parade plan
text: animal cruelty cry over bull parade plan

documents.title: is herefordshire an earthquake hotspot ?
text: is herefordshire an earthquake hotspot ?
author: Danielle Hayden
BBC News

documents.title: no further action over stab death
text: no further action over stab death

documents.title: paedophile hunter : 'police too stretched '
text: paedophile hunter : 'police too stretched '

documents.title: the women the war turned yellow
text: the women the war turned yellow
author: Lauren Potts
BBC News

documents.title: inside one of the largest poultry sites
text: inside one of the largest poultry sites

documents.title: cricket : worcestershire v gloucestershire day two
text: you can hear full ball-by-ball commentary on the second day of worcestershire 's championship match against gloucestershire on bbc hereford & worcester 's 738am frequency and online .
worcestershire are currently 338-7 in the first innings .
day 2 @ twitterid v gloucestershire

documents.title: civil war park opens interactive memory trail
text: visitors to a worcester park can now go back in time to experience and celebrate events from the past using their smartphones .
a memory trail consisting of plaques with a special qr code has been created at fort royal park , which played a vital part in the final battle of the english civil war .
ian craigan , a community artist who 's been working on the project , says after scanning the code visitors can then watch a video of someone remembering an event .

[ there are videos of ] people who have had their own wedding up in the park , there are young people talking about their experiences in the park [ and ] we 've had older asian people talking about what it means to them

documents.title: court appearance for roundabout tent sleeper
text: a hereford woman who has been sleeping in a tent on one of the city 's busiest roundabouts is due to appear at the city 's magistrates ' court today .
samantha lamputt , aged 33 , is charged with breaking a criminal behaviour order to prevent her from sleeping in public places such as the bandstand in ross-on-wye .

documents.title: watch : mum calls for hospital bereavement suite
text: a hereford mother whose daughter was still-born says the county needs a dedicated bereavement suite and midwife .
laura culpin , from pontrilas , is now helping to fundraise for a new maternity bereavement suite at hereford county hospital to improve the experience for other families who lose a baby at birth .
author: BBC Hereford and Worcester

documents.title: cricket : 'hopefully we can win the game in two sessions ' - moeen
text: moeen ali 's fine counter-attacking innings laid the foundation for england to push for a final-day victory in the second test against west indies .
england lost three wickets before tea before the worcestershire all-rounder made a 93-ball 84 to help his side declare on 490-8 , a lead of 321 .
i felt good before tea and thought to keep playing the same and when the bad balls come try and put them away .
me and chris woakes tried to build five-run partnerships .
hopefully we can win the game in two sessions

documents.title: fatal crash closes major road
text: a man has died and a woman has been taken to hospital after a crash in herefordshire last night .
police were called to a collision between a tractor and a car by the axe & cleaver , at much birch , shortly before 22:00 .
the a49 is expected to remain closed for much of the day , with diversions in place via the a40 to monmouth and the a466 through wormelow .
author: Justyn Surrall
BBC Hereford and Worcester

documents.title: watch : your weather forecast for the next 24 hours
text: a fairly cloudy day with some sporadic outbreaks of drizzle .
for all it will feel much cooler , with highs of 20c ( 68f ) .
author: Rich Davis
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: d'oliveira & cox put worcs on top
text: d'oliveira & cox put worcs on top

text: lorry driver in court over m1 deaths
