text: barnard & d'oliveira extend pears deals

documents.title: tongue pens new deal with worcestershire
text: tongue pens new deal with worcestershire

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: live updates have finished for the day but local stories will be added automatically through the night .
we 'll be back from 08:00 on tuesday with more live news , sport , travel and weather .

documents.title: rugby : warriors ' game rescheduled
text: worcester warriors ' game against leicester tigers at welford road has been moved to saturday 25 november , with a 15:00 kick-off .
the game was due to be televised , but bt sport have chosen sale sharks vs northampton saints instead .

documents.title: herefordshire vc winner : 'he deserves more than just a stone '
text: a campaign has been started to erect a bronze statue in memory of the only man born in herefordshire to win the victoria cross .
allan leonard lewis was killed a century ago in world war one , as the allied forces made their final push to break the german hindenburg line .
the train driver , from witney-on-wye , was 23 when he died and is remembered on a plaque in his local church .
his great-niece , dawn lewis , believes he deserves a better memorial .
he is the only person born in herefordshire to get a victoria cross .
i think he should have more than just a stone - this is where the idea has come from to create this bronze statue . ''
author: Nicola Goodwin
Reporter, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: tour of britain : herefordshire route
text: if you are planning to go along and watch the action , here 's the route and the approximate time the riders will be passing .
the @ twitterid finale is coming to herefordshire on sun 10 sept with a ledbury sprint - shops & cafes open til 2pm , sprint due at midday
why not make a whole weekend of @ twitterid linking with cheltenham stage 7 finish on 9 september ?
# cheltcyclefest @ twitterid

documents.title: watch : your 50-second weather forecast
text: tonight will be rather cloudy , and although it will stay dry for many there is a risk of a few showers .
some clear spells are possible leading to a few mist patches around dawn - lows of 16c ( 61f ) .
and the weather is looking promising for the bank holiday .
author: Rebecca Wood
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: rugby : warriors squad ahead of season starting
text: there 'll be full commentary on every worcester warriors game , home and away , on bbc hereford & worcester .
their season kicks off next friday with an away game at newcastle falcons .

documents.title: shotguns stolen in raid on house
text: four shotguns have been stolen from a farmhouse in north herefordshire , police say .
the licensed firearms were taken from a property in orleton just after 21:00 on wednesday , along with the gun safe they were kept in .
west mercia police say no ammunition is believed to have been taken during the burglary .

documents.title: your heron in the park
text: one of our regular contributors , paul wilde , took these great photos in abbey meadows in redditch .
i 'd love to feature your photos - you can email , tweet us on @ twitterid or message via facebook .
author: Jerry Chester
BBC News Online

documents.title: cctv image released after 11-year-old girl assaulted
text: an 11-year-old girl has been assaulted near a play area in evesham .
police have released a cctv image of a man they say may have `` vital information '' .
west mercia police says the incident happened between 15:20 and 15:40 yesterday , in a field by the playing area that leads from brookside off pershore road , in the hampton area of the town .
police are linking the assault to a similar incident which took place the same day at about 13:30 , when a man assaulted a 12-year-old girl in davies road .
the man may have been driving a small van , a spokesman said .

documents.title: valkyries prepare for world cup final
text: england 's women are getting ready to to defend their rugby world cup title in tomorrow night 's final .
two worcester valkyries players , lydia thompson ( and rochelle clark , are in the squad which will face new zealand in belfast .
[ it 's ] really exciting - it 's a big day on everyone 's calendar , [ all ] 15 players . ''

documents.title: london midland changes signage to acknowledge invisible disabilities
text: train provider london midland has announced it will change its signs on accessible toilets to acknowledge invisible disabilities .
the new signs will be displayed on all accessible toilets throughout london midland 's 43 stations .
dan mclean , from crohn 's and colitis uk , said it was a great step towards `` reducing stigma and raising awareness that not every disability is visible '' .
author: Riyah Collins
BBC West Midlands

documents.title: invading hornet bad news for honey bees
text: invading hornet bad news for honey bees
author: David Gregory-Kumar
Science, Environment & Rural Affairs Correspondent

documents.title: your hay field in the morning sun
text: the worcestershire wildlife trust looks after more than 70 nature reserves in the county .
a lovely morning at # lowersmitefarm .
the last of the hay will soon be ready to bale if the sun keeps shining !

documents.title: power cut hits more than 1,000 homes
text: a power cut has hit 1,282 homes in the wr5 area of worcester - western power distribution says it hopes to have supplies restored by 16:00 .
we are aware of a # powercut in the # wr5 # worcester area .
we aim to restore all supplies by 16:00 .
danielle

documents.title: slideshow : cornfield in the summer sun
text: the summer sun shining this morning has encouraged bbc weather watchers to get out and about with their cameras .
thanks to j at severn ridge , mikesnapper , toppo , johnqa and morning amble for this selection .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: 'lotto gran ' : funeral date announced
text: the funeral of the worcester woman who was dubbed 'lotto gran ' after claiming she had a possible £ 33m winning lottery ticket will take place next month .
susanne hinte , who was 49 , was found dead at her home last monday - further tests are being carried on her body after the results of her post-mortem test were inconclusive .
the service is at worcester crematorium on 6 september - the family are asking for any donations to go to the bereavement charity the last kiss foundation .

documents.title: yurt stolen from field in herefordshire
text: a yurt - an 18ft ( 5,5m ) round tent - has been stolen from a field in herefordshire , police say .
the yurt was taken from a field off the a44 near weobley sometime between tuesday evening and wednesday morning .
yurts were traditionally used as dwellings in turkey and mongolia and are now popular for `` glamping '' .

documents.title: indecent assault of 10-year-old girl
text: a 10-year-old girl has been indecently assaulted by one of three men who asked her to join in a game of football , police say .
west mercia police say the girl and two friends were at a park on jinnah road in redditch ( when the three men approached them and asked if they wanted to play football .
one of the men `` touched the girl inappropriately over her clothing '' and kicked her , before she left with her friends .
police are appealing for any witnesses who saw the incident , which took place on sunday , 13 august at about 19:20. to contact them .

documents.title: channel 4 kidderminster star on trial after row at mcdonalds turns violent
text: a tv builder from kidderminster has denied assaulting two police officers in a mcdonalds car park in redditch , following a row with his estranged wife .
author: Kidderminster Shuttle

documents.title: butcher gets slice of internet fame
text: butcher gets slice of internet fame

documents.title: travel : delays on trains through kidderminster
text: a passenger has been taken ill , affecting services to birmingham .
1/2 due to a passenger being taken ill on a train at kidderminster , the birmingham bound line is disrupted .
services running
2/2 through this station may be delayed .
please accept our apologies for any inconvenience caused .
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: football : city bring keeper in on loan
text: worcester city have signed goalkeeper tom palmer , on an initial one-month loan deal .
palmer , who has already played for the club in pre-season against worcester raiders and halesowen , will come into the squad for saturday 's home match vs loughborough university .

documents.title: clear-up planned of hereford 's duck pond
text: a planned clear-up of hereford 's castle pool could include the installation of signs to discourage people from feeding bread to ducks .
author: Hereford Times

documents.title: watch : campaign for statue honouring vc winner
text: campaigners are hoping that the only recipient of the victoria cross who was born in herefordshire will be honoured with a bronze statue in the city centre .
allan leonard lewis was killed a century ago in world war one , as the allied forces made their final push to break the german hindenburg line .
author: Nicola Goodwin
Reporter, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: change meeting times to get more councillors says opposition group
text: the main opposition group on herefordshire council is calling for the authority 's meeting times to be changed to encourage more people to stand as councillors .
one of their councillors , mark mansell , recently stepped down from his role on the unitary authority as he said he could n't combine it with his work or family life .
it 's our county are asking the council to hold 50 % of their meetings after 16:00 , so that people with full-time jobs can still take part .

documents.title: butcher 's online tutorials go viral
text: a worcester butcher is an internet sensation with his online videos viewed by 40m people around the world .
scott rea 's butchery tutorials have more than a 100,000 subscribers on youtube .
in december the website sent him a letter of congratulations for his popularity .
i just thought i 'll put it on there and people watched it , so you i put another one on there .
and people kept coming on board and i you think i may have something here so you kind of up your game a bit . ''

documents.title: man set up fake facebook profile in victim 's name
text: a malvern man has admitted harassing a former partner through various methods , including setting up a fake facebook profile in her name .
author: Malvern Gazette

documents.title: watch : 'we just wanted to come home '
text: a teenager from kidderminster says she `` just wanted to come home '' after being caught up in one of the spanish terror attacks a week ago .

darcie hancocks , 15 , was at an international judo training camp in cambrils at the same time a woman died when a car was driven into pedestrians and five suspected terrorists were shot dead by police , only hours after the barcelona attack .
author: BBC Hereford and Worcester

documents.title: rugby : loss for warriors in final warm-up game
text: worcester warriors were last night beaten 35-26 by munster in their final warm-up match ahead of the new premiership season .
warriors scored four tries in the first half through sam olver ( perry humphreys , wynand olivier and dean hammond as they led 26-14 at half-time .
munster scored two tries in the final five minutes to close out the win after warriors had made a host of second-half changes .
author: Trevor Owens
Sports Editor, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: today 's weather in 50 seconds
text: the sun 's out already for much of the west midlands - here 's how the rest of friday is looking .
you can keep yourself updated at any other time by getting the latest forecast for your area from the bbc weather website .
author: Alex Hamilton
BBC Weather

documents.title: good morning from today 's herefordshire and worcestershire live page
text: welcome to the local live service for herefordshire and worcestershire on friday morning .
there 'll be a full weather forecast to watch at 08:20 but there 's been a nice start to the day , as this photo from bbc weather watcher gertcorf shows .
i 'll be bringing you all the news , sport , travel and weather as it happens .
if you 'd like to get in touch you can email , tweet us on @ twitterid or message via facebook .
author: Jerry Chester
BBC News Online

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: we 'll be back with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 tomorrow , but keep an eye out here for more updates this evening and into the morning .

documents.title: watch : paramedics in action
text: a documentary series on the work of the west midlands ambulance service will be on tv tonight , featuring paramedics from herefordshire and worcestershire .
series two of ambulance will look at all aspects of their work from the control rooms to the crews on the street .
worcester operations manager , andy allsop , says we 'll definitely get an insight into how they work .
the show is on bbc one at 21:00 .
i think it 's going to give a really good of how the ambulance service really works , so it 's all out there and you can see what we do on a daily basis . ''

documents.title: football : fans try to raise money for player 's treatment
text: fans of hereford fc have launched a crowdfunding page to try and raise the money to treat a player 's injury .
ryan green ( left ) , who 's 36 , has chronic tendonitis in his achilles which requires treatment before he can play without pain again .
the defender has played for the club since 2003 .
fans are hoping to raise £ 1,000 for an injection he needs .
i had surgery on my achilles about eight or nine years ago after getting similar symptoms , but i am advised that a cortisone injection should solve it for a year or two . ''

documents.title: watch : your 50-second weather forecast
text: the cloud will break up during the evening to give some late sunshine and a good chance of another spectacular sunset .
a dry , cool and clear night will follow - lows of 13c ( 55f ) .
author: Rebecca Wood
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: man sought by police after indecent exposure
text: an image has been released of a man police want to speak to in connection with reports of an indecent exposure .
west mercia police say a woman in her 20s saw a man exposing himself in st peter 's square , hereford , at about 15:15 on sunday .

documents.title: a man from kidderminster has been jailed for a string of sex attacks on children
text: a paedophile from kidderminster who sexually assaulted four youngsters - repeatedly raping two of them - has been put behind bars for 27 years .
author: Kidderminster Shuttle

documents.title: slideshow : cows and calming views
text: once the sun broke through the early morning clouds our bbc weather watchers got busy with their cameras .
thanks to postman les , j at severn ridge , chris and ginny and mikesnapper for this selection
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: former factory site to be turned into housing
text: plans to build more than 200 new homes on the site of worcester 's old metal box factory have been approved .
the 7,500-hectare site has been largely empty since industrial units closed in 2013 .
despite concerns over increased traffic , and a lack of any affordable housing , developers taylor wimpey were given the go-ahead today .
author: James Pearson
Political reporter, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: work on herefordshire trunk road overruns
text: work that has closed the a438 around the bridge over the river lugg ( has overrun , meaning the road will stay shut for `` a few days longer than originally planned '' , a power company says .
it will now open on 1 september .
western power distribution ( wpd ) has been carrying out work strengthening the road to protect its cabling that runs underneath and supplies 8,000 customers in hereford .

the company says after it began excavation works it discovered `` technical issues '' which meant the structural reinforcement of the two bridges had to be redesigned , re-engineered and approved by the local authority .
this was a considerable amount of extra work and we were unable to complete it in the original timescales .
we apologise for the delay as we appreciate residents and businesses are looking forward to getting back to normal . ''
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: record gcse results for ledbury students
text: john masefield students were celebrating a record year for gcse results this week .
author: Ledbury Reporter

documents.title: tracey emin decorated car goes on sale
text: a car decorated by one of the country 's most well-known artists is to be sold in herefordshire next month , and could attract bids of more than £ 60,000 , according to the auctioneers .
the fiat 500 , which which has never been driven , is one of only four released to celebrate the car 's relaunch in 2007 - all of which were decorated by the tracey emin
it will be sold by the leominster-based brightwells auctioneers

documents.title: bulmers cider family raid : eleven in court
text: bulmers cider family raid : eleven in court

documents.title: rugby : warriors ' final warm-up game
text: worcester warriors play their final pre-season warm-up game against munster tonight .
the game at sixways kicks off at 19:30 .
hereford & worcester will bring you full match commentary on every warriors game , home and away .

documents.title: food industry warns of brexit workforce shortage
text: the uk food industry has warned that a brexit workforce shortage could leave a third of its businesses unviable .
many fruit and vegetable producers in herefordshire and worcestershire rely on workers from europe to their harvest .
the food and drink federation said its survey of the `` farm-to-fork '' supply chain showed 31 % of businesses had already seen eu workers leave the uk .
it is only a matter of time before the uncertainty reported by businesses results in an irreversible exit of eu workers from these shores .
without our dedicated and valued workforce we would be unable to feed the nation . ''
author: BBC News England

documents.title: west midlands ambulance service stars in new bbc series
text: west midlands ambulance service is the focus of a new fly-on-the-wall series starting on bbc one tonight .
the programme will feature a dramatic 999 call from joan after her husband terry collapsed .

it also follows a service controller trying to juggle between helping a crew search for an elderly man - and a call about a street brawl in which a man is reportedly being attacked with a baseball bat .
the eight-part programme ambulance starts on bbc one tonight at 21:00 .

documents.title: travel : bank holiday roadworks
text: drivers are being told the vast majority of roadworks on motorways will have been completed or lifted by friday morning , with work not set to resume until tuesday - but some are still in place including :
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: historic rubery pub fronts 'perished pubs ' calendar
text: the oldest pub in rubery , which has been mooted for demolition since closing , has been chosen as the cover star of a calendar highlighting birmingham 's perished pubs .
author: Bromsgrove Advertiser

documents.title: rural driving lessons : your comments
text: practising on rural roads should be a compulsory part of driving lessons , according to a road safety charity .
brake is calling for a new licensing system that would include a minimum driving period and restrictions for new drivers , along with the rural training .
here are some of your comments on the idea from the bbc hereford & worcester facebook page .
country roads are on the syllabus so all good driving instructors teach this .
i teach my learners advanced techniques to read the bends too .
we do everything in our power to teach people every aspect of driving and road safety but once they have passed their test we can not control them . ''
passing a driving test does not mean you can drive .
you may pass on one day and be awful behind the wheel the following day .
age should be raised and engine size restricted . ''
i hate to say this but if you really want to stop this then no one should drive til the age of 25 .
too many youngsters have too many accidents .
which is why their insurance premiums are so high . ''
author: BBC Hereford and Worcester

documents.title: leading art works to go on show thanks to arts council grant
text: a worcestershire museum will be able to exhibit paintings from national collections after it was awarded a grant of £ 38,000 from the arts council .
bewdley museum will use the money , from the arts council 's ready to borrow scheme , to develop its gallery space .
the improved gallery space will be completed by february 2019 and the first exhibition will feature works by john ruskin , edward burne-jones and albrecht dürer .

documents.title: pub near worcester set to reopen after the doors closed nine months ago
text: a country pub on a busy main road between worcester and pershore has been bought by a local farming family and is set to reopen on friday 25 august .
author: Worcester News

documents.title: 'yarn bombers ' at work for festival
text: i 've been to pershore , where yarn bombers have been busy decorating the streets ahead of the town 's plumb festival this weekend .
around 30 knitters have been working to create the colourful woollen creations as part of the month-long festival .
author: Nina Das Gupta
Presenter, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: netball : severn stars confirm squad for all-stars championship
text: worcester 's professional netball team the severn stars , run jointly with the university of gloucester , have confirmed their squad for the british fast5 all-stars championship , which is being held at the o2 arena in london .
it features south african players phumza maweni , who plays for kzn kingdom stars , and maryka holtzhausen , who plays for free state .
also included is rosie allison ( - the 26-year-old goal shooter/goal attack has also played for england roses from junior to senior level , taking part in two world youth championships .

eleanor cardwell and jodie gibson , who have just been selected for the england roses ' 2017-18 season , along with england under 21 player , iona darroch , who all played for stars last season , will be back in action as part of the stars ' fast5 squad .
also returning to the squad for the tournament are laura malcolm , becky oatley , sophie carter and clare elsley .

documents.title: unlawful waste disposal prosecution for hereford trader
text: a trader who runs a house clearance business and who unlawfully disposed of waste at a household recycling centre has been been prosecuted by herefordshire council .
david furnell , 48 , of coningsby street , hereford , pleaded guilty at hereford magistrates ' court last friday to two counts of handling controlled waste without taking reasonable measures .
he was fined £ 400 and ordered to pay a victim surcharge of £ 40 and costs of £ 679 .

documents.title: slideshow : spectacular sunset snapped
text: there was a spectacular sunset last night across herefordshire and worcestershire , as you can see from these photos by bbc weather watchers .
thanks to postman les , mikesnapper , kev and happysnapper for this selection .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: football : bulls ' financial director stands down
text: hereford united 's financial director is to stand down from his role on the board of directors , the club has announced .
mike cole has told the club he 's been finding it more and more difficult to balance his own business commitments and home life with his responsibilities as a board member .
the club says it is now looking for an experienced accountant - possibly someone who has recently retired or who works part-time - to fill the voluntary position .
we are all sad that mike is going to step down , but we completely respect his decision and sympathise with the tough choice he has had to make . ''

documents.title: midwives 'devastated ' by colleagues ' deaths in mudslide
text: midwives who have been involved in a five-year partnership between the alexandra hospital in redditch and a hospital in sierra leone say they 're devastated that staff they had been working with have died in recent mudslides .
the partnership involved midwives travelling between africa and the midlands to offer support , which the team say they 'll continue to do
we were actually working there last year and staff from that unit came to our workshops in january this year , and it 's been confirmed that two members of staff from that unit have been lost .
it 's devastating - it 's a lovely little community and as you can imagine the health care system there is very fragile . ''

documents.title: rugby : o'callaghan named as warriors ' captain
text: irish international and british lion donncha o'callaghan will captain worcester warriors this season , the club has announced .
the lock joined warriors from munster rugby in the summer of 2015 and has gone on to make 43 appearances .

documents.title: county councillor blasts council for not taking gull problem seriously
text: a county councillor has said he is appalled that worcester city council is not taking the problem of gull control seriously .
author: Worcester News

documents.title: search for man wanted for serious sexual offence and wounding
text: a man wanted on sus of a serious sexual offence and wounding with intent to cause grievous bodily harm is being sought by police .
west mercia police are asking the public to help them find ashley shearon , but are warning people not approach him as he may be a danger to others .

documents.title: watch : today 's weather in 52 seconds
text: here 's how your forecast is looking for today across the west midlands .
you can also get the latest weather for your area at any other time by going to the bbc weather website .
author: Alex Hamilton
BBC Weather

documents.title: good morning from today 's herefordshire and worcestershire live page
text: welcome to the local live service for herefordshire and worcestershire on thursday morning .
i 'll be bringing you all the news , sport , travel and weather as it happens .
if you 'd like to get in touch you can email , tweet us on @ twitterid or message via facebook .
author: Jerry Chester
BBC News Online

documents.title: solicitor jailed for false £ 20k claim
text: solicitor jailed for false £ 20k claim

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: we 'll be back with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 tomorrow , but keep an eye out here for more updates this evening and into the morning .

documents.title: solicitors jailed for perverting the course of justice
text: two bromsgrove solicitors have been jailed for perverting the course of justice after trying to get more than £ 20,000 from a former employee for breach of contract .
diljit bachada ( 46 , made a county court claim against her former employee , attaching two contracts signed by each of them , the crown prosecution service ( cps ) says .
the cps says the former employee realised she had never signed the contracts and reported the matter to the police .
after a six-week trial at bristol crown court , bachada was found guilty of two counts of perverting the course of justice and two of false representation .
she was sentenced to four and a half years in jail .
fellow solicitor , tharinjit biring , 41 , was also found guilty of perverting the course of justice , and jailed for 19 months .
the cps says biring provided false information in a witness statement .

documents.title: cleobury mortimer man to tour with his enigma machine
text: a cleobury mortimer bookseller is preparing to tour the country , showing people his world war two enigma machine .
mark baldwin has decided it 's time to close his business , saying it 's not possible to make money in the second-hand book trade and that he wants to go on the lecturing circuit instead .
mr baldwin said his enigma machine , one of around 300 to survive the war , is a type commonly used on german u-boats and has heavy , clunky keys .
he explained he got his passion for the devices , along with espionage and counter espionage after reading a book about it .

documents.title: sixty-year-old sign restored for rebuilt bridge
text: a 60-year-old sign for a worcestershire bridge which collapsed has been restored and put in place at the new bridge .
the 18th century grade ii-listed eastham bridge , near tenbury wells , collapsed into the river teme in may 2016 , just as a school bus was about to cross it .
the 1950s sign is now back at the entrance to the new bridge , which opened in april .

documents.title: road closures for city 's half marathon and 10k runs
text: residents are being warned of road closures around worcester in a few weeks time as the city stages a series of races .
some 4,000 people are expected to take part in the half marathon , 10k and junior races on sunday 17 september .
some roads in worcester will shut from 06:00 , with the last reopening at 12:00 .
the council says the closures will be done of a rolling basis to `` minimise disruption in and around the city '' - access for the emergency services will be maintained at all times .
a full schedule of road closures can be found on the city council website .

documents.title: weather : a dry night and some sunshine tomorrow
text: it 's not going to be especially warm tomorrow , but it should be dry , with some sunshine appearing from behind the clouds .
and we are forecast a dry and cloudy night .
author: Shefali Oza
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: exhibition showcases young filmmakers
text: more than 200 films made by up-and-coming young filmmakers , aged 16-24 , are being showcased at the hive in worcester as part of a touring exhibition .
among the films being showcased in the playback exhibition are ones made by artists based in herefordshire and worcestershire :
as part of the exhibition there will be free workshops for young people with an interest in filmmaking .
the exhibition will be in worcester on 1 september .

documents.title: daughters ' dolls given a makeover
text: daughters ' dolls given a makeover

documents.title: bank holiday fireworks spectacular
text: this year 's display in worcester is raising money for st richards hos

documents.title: 'large amount of money ' stolen in takeaway robbery
text: a `` large amount of money '' has been stolen from a takeaway by a man who threatened staff , police say .
the money was taken from the subway shop on stourport road in kidderminster between 18:15 and 18:20 on saturday .
west mercia police say no-one was injured in the robbery , but it was a `` traumatic experience for the members of staff '' .

documents.title: retirement homes plan for former bus station
text: dozens of retirement homes could be built in the centre of hereford .
mccarthy and stone have applied to landscape the site of the old bus depot in friars street ( and use it for the new apartments .
they 're holding a public exhibition at the museum resource centre from 15:00 to 19:00 today .
author: Nicola Goodwin
Reporter, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: breakingroad closures for cycle event approved
text: plans to close roads to allow a massive cycling event involving 15,000 riders to take place have been approved by worcestershire county council , despite vocal opposition .
the 100-mile velo birmingham bike ride will follow a route that goes through parts of north worcestershire on september 24 .
farms and businesses on the route have raised concerns that their trade will be disrupted by the event .
the county council says the event organisers have `` worked closely '' with it to `` make sure that the concerns of those people who live and work along the route have been addressed '' .

the route for velo birmingham , which the council say is the biggest event of its kind outside of london , will travel through villages like wolverley , bewdley , ombersley and belbroughton and the town of droitwich .

documents.title: man ordered to pay compensation after biting bouncer
text: a man bit a bouncer at a hereford nightclub after being refused entry , a court heard .
author: Hereford Times

documents.title: slideshow : hay bales and blue skies
text: as the sun breaks through this morning 's cloud cover , bbc weather watchers have been out and about taking some great photos .
thanks to mikesnapper , johnqa , weather geek and morning amble for this selection .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: rugby : o'callaghan and stringer face old club
text: donncha o'callaghan will captain worcester warriors against his former club munster for the club 's final pre-season game ahead of the new premiership season .
his former ireland and munster teammate peter stringer is also in worcester 's starting 15 .
kick-off at sixways tomorrow night is at 19:45 .

documents.title: child neglect reports double in five years
text: children 's charity the nspcc says it 's referring an average of four reports of child neglect every week to police and social services in worcestershire .

the survey shows the charity dealt with a total of 233 calls from concerned adults in the county last year , and 48 from herefordshire where the number of referrals to the police has doubled in the last five years .

documents.title: heritage railway announces 'night-time steaming ' line-up
text: four visiting locomotives , including one from the ffestiniog railway in wales , will take part in the severn valley railway 's autumn steam gala .
the heritage line will also be running trains through the night ( as on friday 22 september and saturday 23 september .
the `` guest '' locomotives at the gala will be :

documents.title: on midlands today from 13:30 : rise in biker deaths
text: on midlands today this lunchtime , we 'll be looking at the shocking news that motorcycle deaths have been increasing in the region .
we 'll have more , including how the summer months see fatalities more than double compared with the winter , on bbc one from 13:30 .
author: Laura Mcmullan
Reporter, BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: trolley hell cancer patient wins support
text: a cancer patient says he is determined to bring about change at a worcester hospital after he was flooded with letters of support for speaking out about his hospital trolley hell .
author: Worcester News

documents.title: pensioner targeted by thieves who followed her home from the shops
text: an 80-year-old woman has had her purse stolen by two men who followed her home from the shops , police say .
west mercia police say the woman had been shopping at the londis shop in far forest , kidderminster , on sunday at about 13:20 , when two men spoke to her .
as she pulled up outside her house having driven home , she noticed the two men had followed her home in another car .
the driver asked for directions to the m5 , while the other man stole her purse .
there were a lot of people shopping in the londis store between 13:00 and 13:20 when the victim was there , and we are keen to speak to anyone who remembers seeing men . ''

documents.title: what 's that helicopter doing flying so low ?
text: if you see a yellow helicopter flying low over worcester today , it 's checking overhead electricity lines for western power distribution .
they love to get photos of their machine in action , so tweet them if you take one .
today our helicopters are flying in # torbay , # nottingham and # worcester .
thanks to chris hurn for the # wpdspotted

documents.title: bromsgrove advertiser back page : boss hits back after fans abuse players
text: unhappy bromsgrove sporting boss paul smith has hit out at the supporters who abused his players in the wake of their 4-3 fa cup defeat to coleshill town this week .
author: Bromsgrove Advertiser

documents.title: woodland closed due to 'inappropriate ' behaviour is set to reopen
text: a woodland that was closed after complaints about attacks and intimidation by out-of-control dogs and `` inappropriate use of the car park '' could reopen in the autumn , the charity running it says .
uffmoor wood , near halesowen , was closed by the woodland trust in may .
the trust says it has cleared fly-tipping and dens , and carried out essential maintenance work , and is now `` looking very carefully at how we make sure the wood is safe for local people '' .
people are still trespassing in the wood , the charity says , but it hopes to reopen the wood in the autumn or by the end of the year at the latest .
we 're also working with volunteers to check the woods regularly , and looking at how we make sure the car park continues to be locked every night to deter anti-social behaviour .
signage will also be clearer , so people know how to report issues , and know our policies regarding the wood . ''

documents.title: bromsgrove advertiser front page : urgent plea for cctv on crime-ridden estate
text: fearful residents in rock hill are calling on the council to review its cctv coverage in a crime-hit housing estate , after witnessing a rise in drug-dealing , fly-tipping and prostitution 'on their doorsteps ' .
author: Bromsgrove Advertiser

documents.title: travel : alvechurch road closed for three days
text: red lion street in alvechurch will reopen at the weekend .
red lion street in # alvechurch is closed for works for three days and will reopen over the weekend
any more detail pls ?
time ?
which end ?
etc
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: watch : the future for historic green
text: hereford 's historic castle green will soon be run by a community group , when the council hands over control of the area .
the friends of castle green want to see the green space and former art college building used more by local people .
author: Nicola Goodwin
Reporter, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: world cup final for two valkyries
text: worcester valkyries ' players lydia thompson ( and rochelle clark will have a chance to play in a world cup final after england won a tense semi-final tie against france last night .
the sides were level at 3-3 at half-time , but england stretched away after the break to run out winners by 20-3
the final against new zealand will take place in belfast on saturday evening .

documents.title: wildlife trust plans conversion and sale of farm buildings to fund developement
text: herefordshire wildlife trust says it has had to abandon plans to renovate the dilapidated buildings on farm it owns , as the cost of conversion is too high .
the trust bought birches farm , a traditional farm , nature reserve and site of special scientific interest ( sssi ) in 2015 , using money from members and supporters .
it had hoped to use lottery money to turn the ruined farm buildings into a visitor centre and offices , but funding rules meant this would have cost about £ 500,000 .
instead , the trust hopes to convert the l-shaped barn for residential use , and sell it on the open market .
the money raised would be used to build a tool store , volunteer facility and teaching space on the footprint of the threshing barn .
if planning permission is granted and a sale is made in early 2018 , the trust aims to have the work completed by the end of 2018 .

documents.title: football : city out of the fa cup
text: worcester city last night bowed out of the fa cup when they were beaten 2-0 in their preliminary round replay at chasetown .
two more of our local clubs will be in fa cup replay action this evening .
westfields will take on afc wulfrunians at allpay park while evesham united will be at home to newcastle town .
in other games , richard gregory scored twice for bromsgrove sporting as they beat stourport swifts 3-1 in their midland league premier division game at the victoria ground .
author: Trevor Owens
Sports Editor, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: shock at record number of child neglect cases
text: a children 's charity referred more than double the number of child neglect cases to police and social services in worcestershire than five years ago , shocking new figures have revealed .
author: Worcester News

documents.title: charity left short of money by council payment failure
text: a community transport charity in worcestershire says problems with the county council 's online payment system means it has n't received thousands of pounds in grants and contracts , which is having a `` dire effect '' on finances .
wyre forest dial-a-ride regularly help more than 200 people who ca n't access public transport .
hereford & worcester understands 13 community transport schemes in total have been affected by the problems with the payment system .
worcestershire county council says it 's aware of the issue with dial-a-ride , and that payment will be made by tomorrow .
author: James Pearson
Political reporter, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: watch : your 50-second weather forecast
text: it will be rather cloudy during the morning and some rain is likely in shropshire and staffordshire .
as the rain and cloud clears to the east , brighter and fresher weather will spread in from the west by afternoon - highs of 21c ( 70f ) .
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: good morning from today 's herefordshire and worcestershire live page
text: welcome to the local live service for herefordshire and worcestershire on wednesday morning .
there 's plenty of cloud about this morning , as you can see from this taken in kidderminster by bbc weather watcher , mags - full weather forecast at 08:20 .
i 'll be bringing you all the news , sport , travel and weather as it happens .
if you 'd like to get in touch you can email , tweet us on @ twitterid or message via facebook .
author: Jerry Chester
BBC News Online

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: we 'll be back with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 tomorrow , but keep an eye out here for more updates this evening and into the morning .

documents.title: farrier house given boutique student accommodation facelift
text: work to transform an unused part of a worcester building into boutique student accommodation has now been completed .
author: Worcester News

documents.title: castle green : opening up the river and the ruins
text: the community group who will take over the running of castle green in hereford say they want to open up the area so more visitors and people from the city are able to use and enjoy the open space .
the park is being transferred from herefordshire council to the friends of castle green .
the green , close to the river wye , contains a monument to lord nelson and the ruins of the city 's castle , dismantled in 1746 .
[ we plan to make ] best use of the river bank , extending it to open a cafe [ so ] people strolling by can stop and have a coffee and enjoy the views .
also make best use of the ruins so they are accessible for the community for yoga , pilates , parties , community events - just helping the place to thrive . ''

documents.title: work to begin to expand a & e department
text: work to expand hereford county hospital 's a & e department will begin next month .
the wye valley nhs trust plans to extend the waiting room , consulting area and clinics and move the ambulance bays closer to the entrance .
the trust say the work means patients will be seen and treated more quickly from october - it should be finished by the end of the year .

documents.title: weather : a humid night and some sunshine tomorrow
text: we 're in for another warm and humid night and there could be some more showers tomorrow morning , but it will clear up by the afternoon and we could see some sunshine .
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: the wheels on the bus go splish , splash , splosh : new road flooding in
text: plans have been submitted to raise the level of new road in worcester , and install new drainage , to try to keep the road open during floods .
this slideshow shows how bad flooding can be in the area

documents.title: historic city centre site transferred to community group
text: the job of looking after and promoting hereford 's historic castle green is being handed to a community group .
the park is being transferred from herefordshire council to the friends of castle green , who want to see more people using the green space in the heart of the city .
the green occupies the former site of hereford castle , which was dismantled in 1746 , with its moat becoming the castle pool lake .
nelson 's column stands on the green , put up in 1809 , though it has no statue to the famous admiral , as the money ran out .

documents.title: plan to raise city road to prevent flooding awaiting approval
text: plans for a £ 1.2m scheme to prevent flooding in the centre of worcester has been submitted by the county council .
it would involve raising the level of new road and installing a new drainage system .

the road would be raised between worcestershire county cricket club 's entrance and the premier inn to allow it to be kept open to both vehicles and pedestrians in the event of the river severn flooding .
a final decision is anticipated in december 2017 and , if successful , , construction could start in january 2018 and finish in late spring .

it will alleviate some of the problems faced by people trying to get in and out of the city and by keeping people moving , without the need for the shuttle buses , we can ensure that worcester stays open for business . ''

documents.title: mothers feel let down by special needs school 'prison ' building
text: mothers feel they are being let down by a special needs school building , which has been compared to a prison .
author: Worcester News

documents.title: rugby : warriors ' european fixture dates
text: the dates of warriors ' european challenge cup fixtures have been confirmed :

documents.title: kidderminster man charged after tomkinson drive collision
text: a man has been charged after a collision which saw a van end up on its side in a kidderminster road .
author: Kidderminster Shuttle

documents.title: slideshow : red leaves and blue skies
text: now that the mist has cleared , bbc weather watchers have been out and about getting some great photos .
thanks to janiejane , j at severn ridge , mikesnapper and morning amble for this selection .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: watch : tips from a running legend
text: i 've been to meet steve cram ahead of worcester 's annual 10k run and the new half marathon .
as race organiser and former world champion he has been able to give me a few tips .
author: Elliott Webb
Breakfast presenter, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: graffiti cleared from two subways
text: volunteers and council workers have cleared graffiti from two subways in kidderminster .
the subways in comberton hill were repainted - one in teal and the other in blue - by volunteers , including workers from the mcdonalds in the town .
i 'd like to thank everyone who took part in this latest joint venture .
it is always rewarding to see the council working in partnership with local residents and businesses to keep the district clean and looking good . ''

documents.title: adventurer sends mental health message to herefordshire
text: an adventurer has conquered every summit in the uk including the black mountain as part of a 5,000 mile challenge to raise mental health awareness .
author: Hereford Times

documents.title: fake lawyer jailed for eight years
text: a `` fantasist '' who posed as a barrister when contacting a couple in ross-on-wye to tell them they 'd breached planning regulations has been jailed for eight years .
michael cremin , 41 , formerly of buncombe way , cirencester , was convicted of six counts of fraud and one of pretending to be a barrister at bristol crown court .
cremin carried out other frauds to purchase at least 14 cars which gloucestershire police believe total more than £ 330,000 .
the jury heard cremin advertised himself as a lawyer and falsely claimed to have a law degree from the university of london .
in the case of the couple in ross-on-wye , he wrote to them , using the name of a real barrister , saying they had breached planning regulations by putting posts on a public bridleway .
author: BBC News England

documents.title: grass cuttings from verges used to help save wild flowers
text: grass cuttings from roadside verges are being spread on wetland meadows in the hope they spread traditional flowers and plants .
they 'll be used on the avon meadows community wetlands and local nature reserve in pershore .
wychavon district council say the cuttings come from the roadside verge nature reserve network , managed by worcestershire county council .
the cuttings contain seeds from flowering plants like knapweeds and scabious , even rare orchids and the council hopes to `` transplant some of that diversity to avon meadows '' .
we 're really hopeful that this project will work and bring us an exciting new mix of wild flowers to the meadows .
having a good mix really does help the local wildlife , especially wild pollinators which we have in abundance , but we 're always looking for more diversity for the area . ''

documents.title: feedback on festival wanted by council
text: about 8,500 attended the annual morton stanley festival held in redditch on saturday and sunday , the council says .
redditch borough council is now asking those who went , and local residents , for the views about how they would would like the festival to look in future years in an online survey .

we would like to continue putting on this excellent event for years to come but need to make sure it 's exactly what our residents and visitors want , so i would encourage everyone - whether you attended this year or not - to complete the survey and tell us what you like or what you might do differently . ''

documents.title: football : fa cup replays
text: there will be fa cup replays for westfields and worcester city this evening .
westfields will host afc wulfrunians while worcester city face a trip to chasetown .
author: Trevor Owens
Sports Editor, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: what 's that helicopter doing flying so low ?
text: if you see a helicopter flying low over hereford today do n't worry - it 's checking overhead electricity lines for western power distribution .
they love people to tweet them of the helicopter at work , so get snapping .
our helicopters are in # torbay # plymouth # chesterfield # mansfield # hereford # ludlow # cardiff .
thanks for the pic @ twitterid # wpdspotted

documents.title: new £ 6m scheme launched to improve pavements
text: an extra £ 6m is to be spent on improving worcestershire pavements over the next two years , the county council has pledged .
author: Kidderminster Shuttle

documents.title: security alert at station caused by water bottle
text: a security alert which closed worcester foregate street station was caused by a water bottle with a security tag around it , british transport police say .
police put a 100m ( 330ft ) cordon in place just before 16:30 yesterday afternoon , following reports of a sus package .
the station quickly reopened when they realised what the item was , but rail services were disrupted through rush hour .

documents.title: football : loan striker for bulls
text: hereford fc have brought in forward gethyn hill on loan from weston-super-mare for a month .
the club say with mike symons ' suspension confirmed as three matches , and lance smith still unavailable , the 22-year-old former cardiff city trainee will `` bolster forward options '' .
hill will be available for saturday 's trip to st neots .

documents.title: bromsgrove football boss hits back after players face barrage of abuse
text: unhappy bromsgrove sporting boss paul smith has hit out at the supporters who abused his players in the wake of their 4-3 fa cup defeat to coleshill town this week .
author: Bromsgrove Advertiser

documents.title: buses on some routes managing a nippy 6mph average
text: national express says traffic has become so bad in parts of the west midlands buses on some of its routes have an average speed of less than 6mph .
the company says some routes are 10 minutes slower than they were just three years ago , adding it is concerned the situation will lead encourage bus users to switch to cars .
author: BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: man in 60s racially abused and punched in unprovoked attack
text: a man in his 60s has been punched and kicked several times causing `` serious facial injuries that have required hospital treatment '' in a racially aggravated assault in redditch , police say .
west mercia police say the assault took place on friday when the man was walking up melbury way , in the direction of the ymca .
an unknown man approached the victim , shouting and asking for money , at which point the victim said he does not speak fluent english and did not understand .
the offender then racially abused the victim , before punching him to the floor .
this was a particularly nasty and unprovoked assault that has caused serious injuries to the victim and left him understandably shaken . ''

documents.title: director claims police lost £ 90,000 in historic number plate sale
text: a company director claims the police lost out on £ 90,000 by selling a historic number plate to a former chief constable - as it emerged that the sale was n't announced until 21 days after the deal was agreed .
author: Worcester News

documents.title: your misty start to the day
text: a blanket of mist lay across herefordshire and worcestershire this morning .
weather watcher , maggs , took her photograph in kidderminster , and johnqa took his in lyonshall .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: cycle race road closures 'not finalised '
text: with only a month to go until 15,000 come through worcestershire for the velo birmingham cycle event , the county council has told bbc hereford & worcester the planned road closures are n't actually final yet .
businesses on the route are worried they 'll be forced to shut for the day while some farmers say the closures will mean they struggle to take care of their livestock .

what we have said is that we must listen to all those people who say it 's a good idea and all those people who say it 's a bad idea and all those businesses that might be badly affected because they wo n't be able to carry of their business on that day and weigh those things in the balance and decide whether we should go ahead . ''
councillor pollock says the council will make its decision within one or two days .
the organisers say they 've put together a `` bespoke traffic management plan '' to ensure there is both pedestrian and vehicle access to the inn throughout the day .
they 've told bbc hereford & worcester they are visiting every business along the route to try to resolve any access issues .

documents.title: rugby : two valkyries in semi-final action
text: two worcester valkyries ' players will be in the england squad that will be chasing a place in the women 's rugby world cup final later today .
lydia thompson ( will start the game against france on the wing while prop rochelle clark is named among the replacements .
tonight 's match in belfast is due to kick off at 19:45 .
author: Trevor Owens
Sports Editor, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: watch : your 50-second weather forecast
text: it will be a fine , warm and rather humid day with plenty of sunny spells .
a few showers may develop through the afternoon , but most will remain dry and winds will be light .
highs of 24c ( 75f ) .
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: good morning from today 's herefordshire and worcestershire live page
text: welcome to the local live service for herefordshire and worcestershire on tuesday morning .
i 'll be bringing you all the news , sport , travel and weather as it happens .
if you 'd like to get in touch you can email , tweet us on @ twitterid or message via facebook .
author: Jerry Chester
BBC News Online

documents.title: transplant girl , 3 , can 'start life '
text: transplant girl , 3 , can 'start life '

documents.title: horse , car and speed camera among stolen police property
text: a horse , a car and a speed camera are among the latest list of items reported to have been stolen from west mercia police .
the figures , for the last two-and-a-half years , also record the theft of a police baton , a finger print kit , and a bicycle .
from the start of 2015 , 31 items were reported stolen by the force , with a third of them later being recovered .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: we 'll be back with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 tomorrow , but keep an eye out here for more updates this evening and into the morning .

documents.title: young hereford swimmer makes national finals
text: a hereford schoolboy has been selected to be part of the swimming squad at the 2017 school games national finals .
sixteen-year-old james bilbao , a student at ellesmere college , is already a bronze medallist at the asa national winter meet over 25m .
the school games are a four-day , multi-sport event for the uk 's most talented school-age athletes and will take place at loughborough university from 31 august .
the school games national finals provide a great opportunity for talented young athletes like james .

competitors get a real taste of what it 's like to be part of a world-class sporting event at the amazing sporting venues of loughborough university , and the event is a great way to see our future sporting champions in action today . ''

previous competitors include paralympic champions hannah cockroft , ellie simmonds and jonnie peacock , olympic champion adam peaty , heptathlete katarina johnson-thompson and gb sprinter adam gemili .

documents.title: cricket : rest and hard training for worcestershire
text: worcestershire 's director of cricket steve rhodes says the coming week for the players will be a mixture of rest and hard training sessions .
worcestershire have four championship matches remaining this season and are still in with a very good chance of promotion in the four-day game .
first up will be a home match against gloucestershire starting on bank holiday monday .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: road closed in worcester after sewer collapse
text: new street in worcester has been closed to traffic after a sewer collapsed leaving a small hole in the road surface .
severn trent has cordoned off the area while staff wait for a team to arrive to investigate the problem further .
the road remains open to pedestrians .
the sewer is 3.5 metres beneath the ground and we 'll have a team on site as soon as we can to start digging down to it .
in the meantime the road will remain closed as a safety precaution , we 're really sorry for any inconvenience this causes . ''

documents.title: weather : more cloudy weather to come
text: there will be more cloud around tomorrow and maybe some rain later in the day , but it should be getting drier and warmer as the week goes on .
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: station reopens after security alert
text: that did n't take long .
worcester foregate steret station is now reopening , the bbc understands .
earlier , the police said they had been called to deal with sus package found on a train .
the package in question is no longer regarded as a security concern , british transport police say .
train operator london midland says the station is now reopening to travellers , but warned of delays on the network .

documents.title: sus item reported on board train
text: worcester foregate street station has been evacuated due to reports of a sus item found on board a train , police say .
officers are understood to be at the station .

documents.title: travel : foregate street station evacuated
text: worcester 's foregate street station has been evacuated due to a security alert .
london midland say trains are currently unable to exit or enter the station .
we 'll bring you more details when we get them .
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: sinkhole opens up outside reindeer court in new street , worcester
text: an historic city centre road looks set to be closed for a week after a sinkhole opened up .
author: Worcester News

documents.title: travellers set up camp on business park
text: police in bromsgrove say they are monitoring a business park at stoke prior after a group of travellers parked their vehicles on private land there over the weekend .
officers have been to saxon business park to talk to both the travellers and the land owners .
author: Claudia Berry
Producer, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: evesham grandfather 's gift of life
text: an evesham grandfather has saved the life of his granddaughter , who was told she would n't live beyond the age of five without a new kidney .
john powell , 64 , donated one of his kidneys to his three-year-old granddaughter penny , who was born with abnormal kidneys , chronic lung disease and two holes in her heart .
he says it was a huge relief to find he shared her rare blood type .
when my son first had penny , it was horrendous .
we 'll sell the house , we 'll sell everything and get her sorted , whatever the money .
but of course it 's not about money , it 's about having a kidney and so i was very fortunate to have the same blood [ type ] , and the fact is we only need one kidney . ''
author: Gavin Kermack
Reporter, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: football : worcester prepare for fa cup replay
text: worcester city are preparing for an fa cup replay at chasetown after yesterday 's tie at the victoria ground ended in a one-all draw .
chasetown took a first-half lead but aaron brett levelled for city on the stroke of half-time .
city 's brad birch was sent off in the second half while chasetown were also reduced to ten men .
the replay at chasetown is scheduled for tomorrow evening .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: herefordshire communities look forward to high speed broadband
text: herefordshire has some of the slowest broadband speeds in the uk , but it 's about to get some of the fastest .
the county 's fastershire scheme has partnered up with providers gigaclear , and is set to give tens of thousands of rural homes access to ultrafast broadband over the next two years .
author: Nicola Goodwin
Reporter, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: pregnant woman spared jail after smuggling drugs
text: a pregnant kidderminster woman claimed she had been pushed into smuggling drugs into prison , after threats were made to her family .
author: Kidderminster Shuttle

documents.title: your photos : fog slow to clear across herefordshire and worcestershire
text: the mist and fog is only just starting to lift across herefordshire and worcestershire .
thanks to bbc weather watchers toppo in bodenham and tikka walker in leominster for these two stunning landscape shots .

documents.title: vehicles and caravans on saxon business park
text: caravans and cars have parked up on private land at saxon business park in stoke prior .
author: Malvern Gazette

documents.title: worcester ukulele club wins worldwide recognition
text: worcester ukulele club has been named as one of the top 20 of its kind in the world .
they 've come in at number 14 , the highest-ranking uk entry , on a list compiled by the american website ukelele music info .
in the last five years , the club has grown from 14 members to more than 100 and has now moved its monday night rehearsals to the fownes hotel to accommodate everyone .
i think we 're all just enthusiastic .
we just love what we 're doing .
when we do a performance people hear us playing and just want to join us . ''
author: Gavin Kermack
Reporter, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: high speed broadband promised 'by the end of 2018 '
text: properties in herefordshire still without high speed broadband should get a super-fast connection by the end of next year .
the council says its fastershire project has reached 83 % of the county , despite the challenges of covering such a rural area .
councillor david harlow , the cabinet member for the economy , says providing a reliable internet connection is the key to its economic strategy .
we 've partnered with a company called gigaclear and they lay down completely their own infrastructures .
they do n't rely on what 's already in the ground .
we reckon [ they 'll have covered all properties in herefordshire ] by the end of 2018 . ''
author: Nicola Goodwin
Reporter, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: man suffers life-threatening injuries
text: a man in his 30s has suffered life-threatening injuries in a crash in redditch .
he was a passenger in a car that hit a barrier on the mcdonalds island on moons moat drive at around 02:30 on sunday .
the driver of the silver gen 2 proton saloon , a man in his 40s , was taken to hospital with minor injuries .

documents.title: travel : eckington bridge closed for four days
text: eckington bridge near pershore has been closed for the next four days for emergency repairs .
worcestershire county council says cyclists and pedestrians will still be able to access the bridge .

documents.title: redditch born harry styles shares his life story
text: worcestershire 's harry styles will talk about his life and music as part of a special , one-off tv show .
the redditch-born one direction star will be interviewed by his friend and radio 1 dj nick grimshaw and is expected to discuss his debut number one album and the recent launch of his acting career .

these shows are all about creating a world in which superstars like harry feel incredibly comfortable and alongside their brilliant , live performances , can simply have fun and enjoy revealing more of themselves to viewers than is ever normally possible . ''
the programme will be recorded in front of a studio audience and will be broadcast on bbc one in november .

documents.title: new jobs boost as malvern hills science park expands
text: up to 750 new jobs will be created with the latest development at malvern hills science park .
author: Worcester News

documents.title: county ins & outs 2017
text: county ins & outs 2017

documents.title: travel : trains delayed between hereford and birmingham
text: rail passengers travelling between hereford and birmingham are being warned of delays .
train operator london midland says it 's due to an earlier fault with the signalling system .
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: new ivf rules come into force
text: changes to ivf policy are in place from today , meaning couples across worcestershire struggling to conceive will only be able to receive one round of fertility treatment on the nhs .
the change is estimated to save the local health service around £ 250,000 a year .
health bosses in the county have been criticised by fertility experts , who called it `` deliberate inequality '' .
national charity fertility fairness has previously said the move would mean ivf would only be available to the well-off .
some parts of the uk continue to provide three cycles of ivf , as outlined under nice guidelines .

documents.title: your photos : a misty start to the day
text: fog and mist are giving our bbc weather watchers plenty of photo opportunities this morning .
thanks to johnqa in lyonshall in herefordshire and rickyshentz in malvern in worcestershire for sending in these lovely shots .
author: Claudia Berry
Producer, BBC Hereford & Worcester

documents.title: worcestershire sees 'mini-boom ' in house prices
text: house prices in worcestershire have risen by more than double the national average , according to a new study .
the research by the property website rightmove found asking prices in the county rose by 7 % year on year - just ahead of the west midlands region as a whole , which saw a 6.9 % increase .
asking prices across england and wales rose by 3.1 % .
a combination of traditional summertime price blues and the chill of uncertainty in the air has cooled price growth in some parts of the country , and affordability also remains very stretched .
but despite these factors , high demand and limited supply are still driving momentum , especially in the counties in the middle of the country . ''

documents.title: watch : beer festival clear-up
text: as soon as the visitors left the worcester beer cider and perry festival , the marquees were quickly taken down and the kegs rolled away .
not all the beer and cider was sold , however and some of the alcohol had to be tipped away .

documents.title: boost for organisation supporting children with special needs
text: a malvern-based organisation providing clubs and play schemes for children and young people with disabilities has been awarded a nearly £ 120,000 to support its work .
author: Bromsgrove Advertiser

documents.title: drop in beer festival visitor numbers
text: organisers of the worcester beer festival are blaming bad weather for a drop in visitor numbers this year .
some 9,500 people are thought to have attended the event , which ran from thursday to saturday on the racecourse .
that 's more than 1,000 down on last year 's numbers .
you do n't want to be left with too much at the end .
we 've got puddles of beer here today because any beer that 's left over just gets poured away . ''

documents.title: rural broadband speeds a 'lottery '
text: rural broadband speeds in herefordshire have been described as a `` lottery '' by the leader of the council 's main opposition party .

councillor anthony powers said speeds so far promised by a partnership between the taxpayer-backed fastershire scheme and bt openreach had left many villages without the internet speeds they expected .
the project 's new broadband partners gigaclear is promising to bring the fastest speeds in the country to tens of thousands of homes in herefordshire by 2019 .
i think the pretty patchy .
certainly my own experience of where i live is that they have n't [ met expected speeds ] .
what i hear from many other people around the county is that they have n't got the promised speeds and bandwidth either . ''

documents.title: watch : today 's west midlands ' weather
text: a grey start and there may be rain on the way for your part of the west midlands - here 's today 's forecast .
you can also find the latest forecasts for your area on the bbc weather website .
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: welcome to our live updates for the day
text: welcome to herefordshire and worcestershire live on monday morning .
we 'll be bringing you all the news , sport , travel and weather as it happens .
if you 'd like to get in touch you can email , tweet us on @ twitterid or message via facebook .
